description.narrative: The project will improve about 176 kilometers (km) of state roads in the state of Jharkhand. It will involve upgrading state roads to a two-lane standard. Five year performance-based maintenance will ensure sustainability. The project will also support increasing the institutional capacity of the State Highways Authority of Jharkhand (SHAJ) as an autonomous road development agency aiming to ensure long-term sustainable development and maintenance of the state road network in Jharkhand. SHAJ will become the nodal agency for promoting road safety in Jharkhand based on the road safety master plan to be developed under the project.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Safety and efficiency of the road transport network in Jharkhand state improved

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Annual fatality rates along project roads decreased to less than 5 people/ 10,000 vehicles. (2013 baseline: 9 persons)

description.narrative: Safety and efficiency of the road transport network in Jharkhand state improved

title.narrative: Average daily vehicle-km in the first year of full operations achieved: 1,300,000 for project roads (2013 baseline: 890,000)

description.narrative: Safety and efficiency of the road transport network in Jharkhand state improved

title.narrative: Average travel speed on project roads increased by 20% (2013 baseline: 40 km per hour)

description.narrative: Safety and efficiency of the road transport network in Jharkhand state improved
